Issues.Title: Keyboard event with modifiers and with alert in event handler will fire twice when user is using IME under IE
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.5.14

### Reproduction link
[https://github.com/toBeTheLight/issue-20181104](https://github.com/toBeTheLight/issue-20181104)





### Steps to reproduce
1. Use IME
2. Type some letters
3. Press enter of the keyboard

### What is expected?
Event handler run only once, so alert window only show once

### What is actually happening?
Event handler run twice, so alert window show twice

---
In IE(9-11), after version of 2.5.14, keyboard event with modifiers and with alert (also window.open) in handler will fire twice when user is using IME.

I guess that interrupting javascript execution will cause this problem.

Maybe It is a system or browser bug, but i'm not sure.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

![issue-2018-11-04](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23555178/47963571-f1a2d080-e068-11e8-852c-2467d1fa1365.gif)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Keyboard event with modifiers and with alert in event handler will fire twice when user is using IME under IE" (#9025)

Issues.Title: Hiding/Unhidding jQuery DataTables breaks column widths
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.5.17

### Reproduction link
[http://jsfiddle.net/cardinal177/m7bzjsag/3/](http://jsfiddle.net/cardinal177/m7bzjsag/3/)





### Steps to reproduce
Create a page with multiple jQuery DataTables that are hidden/shown via v-show to a vue data variable.  The initially 'shown' datatable looks fine.  When you switch to the second table, showing it, the column formats are all wrong.  If you change back to the originally working table, it's column widths are broken as well.  <table>.columns.adjust().draw() does not appear to fix this.

I know jQuery plugins are dicey, at best, but all of the DataTables work in done post-rendering of the page.  Don't know why vue.js would prevent this from working.

### What is expected?
The table column widths should be preserved.

### What is actually happening?
Columns widths on an unhidden table has widths all = 0px;

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Hiding/Unhidding jQuery DataTables breaks column widths" (#9024)

Issues.Title: keep-alive no longer caches a component after calling $destroy on it once
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.5.17

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/hellix08/y4Lqvj6u/](https://jsfiddle.net/hellix08/y4Lqvj6u/)





### Steps to reproduce
You are viewing component 'Base' and a counter that shows how many times it's created() lifecycle hook has been called.  

1) Click 'Next' to go to component 'Confirm'.  

2) Click on 'Yes' to go back to 'Base' while also destroying it. It's created() calls counter has increased which is expected.  

3) If you now click 'Next' to go back to component 'Confirm' and press 'No', though, you'll see that it's created() counter has increased.

If you keep pressing 'Next' then 'No' you'll see the created() calls counter keeps increasing even though it didn't before destroying it.

### What is expected?
After manually destroying component 'Base', it is reacreated **once** and cached by keep-alive.

### What is actually happening?
After manually destroying component 'Base', keep-alive creates another instance but no longer caches it, recreating a new instance every time it is shown.

---
I've run into this bug using Vue router but I've fiddled around with it and noticed it has to do with keep-alive.
I'm pretty sure it doesn't have to do with the fact that $destroy is being called just before showing the same component again. In my project the component being destroyed was recreated after another 2-3 components have been shown and the issue remains the same.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "keep-alive no longer caches a component after calling $destroy on it once" (#9019)

If adding a **new feature**, the PR's description includes:
- [ ] A convincing reason for adding this feature (to avoid wasting your time, it's best to open a suggestion issue first and wait for approval before working on it)

**Other information:**

In some instances, the `.composing` flag can be left set as `true` if the user moves focus while they are in the middle of composition. See issue #8945

This fix adds a `blur` handler that sets the `e.target.composing` to `false` if it is still set to `true` when the blur happens.

Issues.Title: Compiler like Svelte.js or Stencil.js
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
I am not a framework expert, but supposedly using a compiler removes the app framework so the final app is lighter and faster, which is especially great for mobile users. Also, Stencil.js claims that their "framework" produces "standards-based Web Components" and that if you make components with their "framework", then those components will be compatible with any other framework. Apparently using a compiler also allows you to add any feature to your framework without adding extra bloat to the framework. I like Vue's design ideas more than either Svelte or Stencil and I think using a compiler would be really awesome for Vue! 

These might be some helpfult links to find out more: 
* https://svelte.technology/
* https://sapper.svelte.technology/
* https://www.infoworld.com/article/3146966/javascript/slim-speedy-svelte-framework-puts-javascript-on-a-diet.html
* https://stenciljs.com/.

### What does the proposed API look like?
I don't have any API proposals. I would love to help out on a project like this, but I wouldn't even know where to begin. If there is some way I can contribute, then please let me know.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Compiler like Svelte.js or Stencil.js" (#9011)

Issues.Title: SSR error during $style injection on cached components
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.5.17

### Reproduction link
[https://github.com/henriqemalheiros/vue-ssr-cached-component-css-modules](https://github.com/henriqemalheiros/vue-ssr-cached-component-css-modules)





### Steps to reproduce
- `yarn install`
- `yarn run ssr:build`
- `yarn run ssr:start`
- Open `http://localhost:8000/`
- Refresh the page

The error is also reproducible in development mode with `yarn run ssr:serve`.

### What is expected?
The app should render properly, as it rendered before refreshing the page.

### What is actually happening?
```
error during render : /
TypeError: Cannot set property '$style' of undefined
    at CachedComponent_injectStyles (src/components/CachedComponent.vue:8:0)
    at hook (node_modules/vue-loader/lib/runtime/componentNormalizer.js:53:0)
    at c:\[...]\vue-ssr-cached-component-css-modules\node_modules\vue-server-renderer\build.js:7467:15
    at c:\[...]\vue-ssr-cached-component-css-modules\node_modules\vue-server-renderer\build.js:2487:40
    at c:\[...]\vue-ssr-cached-component-css-modules\node_modules\vue-server-renderer\build.js:7465:11
    at c:\[...]\vue-ssr-cached-component-css-modules\node_modules\vue-server-renderer\build.js:2487:40
    at renderComponent (c:\[...]\vue-ssr-cached-component-css-modules\node_modules\vue-server-renderer\build.js:7463:7)
    at RenderContext.renderNode (c:\[...]\vue-ssr-cached-component-css-modules\node_modules\vue-server-renderer\build.js:7418:5)
    at RenderContext.next (c:\[...]\vue-ssr-cached-component-css-modules\node_modules\vue-server-renderer\build.js:2436:14)
    at cachedWrite (c:\[...]\vue-ssr-cached-component-css-modules\node_modules\vue-server-renderer\build.js:2295:9)
```

---
If you remove the `serverCacheKey` from the cached component and try again, the app renders properly.

Originally I thought this was a Nuxt related issue (nuxt/nuxt.js#3868). I then forgot about the issue, since I ditched component caching, but now I was able to find the time to reproduce it with plain Vue.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "SSR error during $style injection on cached components" (#9010)

Issues.Title: Cache Problem
Issues.Body:
Hello, we are developing a VueJS based application. We have huge caching problem.

Team members are constantly updating the site but we are getting feedbacks about the solved problems such as typos and miss placed elements.

I personnaly tried the inspect this situation, I found that Chrome reads the files from disk cache or memory cache until the page is refreshed. Even though sometimes chrome still loads the old page when we are re entering the site again (after the refreshing process (ctrl + shift + r)).

I created a website on IIS (local machine windows 10), published the project and tried to reaching it with local ip adress (127.0.0.1:8093), in the network tab I can see the .js and .css files being downloaded then I restart the browser and tried again, this time files are being served from disk cache, I tried couple of times and sometimes files are served from cache and sometimes downloaded.

I tried to add serviceWorker but I got empty handed. Also I created a base project to test some vuejs features and I added same serviceWorker code to the project. It cached again.

Our servers is windows 2012 server with IIS 8.

If it is possible we want no-caching approach or we want to manage what's cached and not. If you can help we would be appreciated.

 You can checkout the base project
[vue-base project](https://github.com/ErenYatkin/vue-base/tree/ver2.1)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Cache Problem" (#9009)

Issues.Title: Can't use arguments with native event handlers
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.5.17

### Reproduction link
[https://codesandbox.io/s/91774v4l7o](https://codesandbox.io/s/91774v4l7o)





### Steps to reproduce
1. Open sandbox
2. Watch the browser as the page navigated to '/about' without any action
3. hit the back button and observe the console which gives the error `Invalid handler for event "click": got undefined`

### What is expected?
Wait until the user interacts and clicks the button to navigate to 'about' page

### What is actually happening?
The user is navigated without any action. If the user forces to go back tot he previous page the console error is thrown

---
Discovered this bug when creating navigation bar and wanted the logo to be a link to the home page using vue-router programmatic navigation. One solution that works is wrapping the event handler in a function as one of the following:
1. `<button onClick={() => this.$router.push("/about")}>Go to about page</button>` or  
2. `<button onClick={this.navigate}>Go to about page</button>` and in methods have a function that does the navigation.

I can't understand why 1. works and 2. is not ideal since we need one method for each link.

Abstracting 2. also produces the same error as the original sandbox. i.e  
`<button onClick={this.navigate("/about")}>Go to about page</button>` and in methods have:  
function (page) {
  this.$router.push(page)
}

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Can't use arguments with native event handlers" (#9005)

Issues.Title: A non-redundant way of importing component.
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Currently, importing a component is somewhat verbose.

We can do: 

```
import SomeComponent from '../common/some-component.vue';
Vue.component('some-component', SomeComponent);
```

or

```
Vue.component('some-component', require('../common/some-component.vue').default);
```

There is redundancy in both ways. There is a shorter API that would reduce a lot of lines in my codebase.

See more dicussion here: https://forum.vuejs.org/t/how-can-i-make-the-component-importing-statement-shorter

### What does the proposed API look like?
Vue.component('../common/some-component.vue')

This might need a modification within vue-loader to support this special statement.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "A non-redundant way of importing component." (#9001)

Issues.Title: Fire of keyboard event with key modifier using IME had been changed in the version of 2.5.14
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.5.14

### Reproduction link
[https://github.com/toBeTheLight/issue-20181029](https://github.com/toBeTheLight/issue-20181029)





### Steps to reproduce
1. Use IME
2. Type some letters in the input with @keydown.down
3. Press the down arrow of the keyboard

### What is expected?
The event is not fired as same as version before 2.5.14

### What is actually happening?
The event is fired in version  2.5.14. 
But it is not fired in version before 2.5.14.

---
When user has not ended composition (compositionend event) with IME, before version of 2.5.14, keyboard events with modifiers (e.g, keydown@enter, keydown@up) will not be fired. 
After version of 2.5.14 it will. 
And the keyboard arrow keys are usually be used to choose the right word, so this change will result in a lot of extra events.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->


![qq20181029-145852](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23555178/47634132-4b982780-db8b-11e8-9262-b0bc1be73158.gif)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Fire of keyboard event with key modifier using IME had been changed in the version of 2.5.14" (#9000)

Issues.Title: Inconsistent formatting with URL for named child route with no path and query params
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[http://jsfiddle.net/u3be49g0/](http://jsfiddle.net/u3be49g0/)





### Steps to reproduce
Open the JSfiddle and click the /user/foo link

### What is expected?
The URL should be /user/foo?test=test_param

### What is actually happening?
The URL is /user/foo/?test=test_param

---
This is a valid URL and the query property of $route still works, but the formatting is inconsistent with how query params are handled with other routes in vue router. This occurs only for named child routes with no path since it will automatically append the trailing slash (see https://github.com/vuejs/vue-router/issues/1273).

Maybe this is intended, but it would be nice if query params were handled the same for all routes.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Inconsistent formatting with URL for named child route with no path and query params" (#2463)

### Steps to reproduce
The path of the RouteConfig is the same as the alias content

### What is expected?
no error

### What is actually happening?
infinite loop

The route of alias overrides the route of the path, causing the path and matchAs to be the same. When the url is parsed, an infinite loop occurs.

Issues.Title: next(false) doesn't render component when using browser navigation
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://codesandbox.io/s/rjwjwqlzlm](https://codesandbox.io/s/rjwjwqlzlm)





### Steps to reproduce
- Use browser navigation to navigate to a page where the `beforeEnter()` method calls `next(false)`.
- Eg. When viewing [rjwjwqlzlm.codesandbox.io/](https://rjwjwqlzlm.codesandbox.io/) in a browser, paste [rjwjwqlzlm.codesandbox.io/](https://rjwjwqlzlm.codesandbox.io/) in the omnibox.

### What is expected?
Like it works when using the router-link navigation, one would expect that changing the URL from `somedomain.com/` to `somedomain.com/admin` (or other "protected" route) would return the user to the previous page.

### What is actually happening?
Instead of working properly, the URL is changed to what it is supposed to be, but no component is rendered at the initial route. 

---
A workaround is using `next(from.fullPath)` instead of using `next(false)`

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "next(false) doesn't render component when using browser navigation" (#2458)

Issues.Title: [Docs] Mistake in Router Construction Options types
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://router.vuejs.org/api/#routes](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#routes)





### Steps to reproduce
In API Reference type of RouteConfig.params is "boolean | string | Function". But in docs in section "Passing Props to Route Components", there are three modes for this. Boolean mode, Object mode, Function mode. This mistake was included in all languages

### What is expected?
boolean | Object | Function

### What is actually happening?
boolean | string | Function

---
Link to section "Passing Props to Route Components" https://router.vuejs.org/guide/essentials/passing-props.html

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Issues.Title: Watch $route doesn't work on first route update
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/4xfa2f19/19326/](https://jsfiddle.net/4xfa2f19/19326/)





### Steps to reproduce
Click either link.

### What is expected?
This should trigger the watch (which should trigger an alert).

### What is actually happening?
Watch is not triggering on first click, only on subsequent clicks.

---
I've been trying to get watch $route working in my own app with mixed results. It has been incredibly frustrating because I thought it was working, then I thought it wasn't working. I still can't get it to work at all in my larger app, nor on codesandbox.io (e.g. https://codesandbox.io/s/6jv5mrnk1k). However on this more simple JsFiddle I thought at first that it also wasn't working but then noticed that it works on second and subsequent route updates only.

I followed the docs here to build up the example: https://router.vuejs.org/guide/essentials/dynamic-matching.html#reacting-to-params-changes
<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Issues.Title: Getters stop to work in routes under keep-alive after registerModule call
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://github.com/Alendorff/vue-vuex-getters-bug](https://github.com/Alendorff/vue-vuex-getters-bug)





### Steps to reproduce
* You have vuex store with static module
* You need to register a new vuex module on vue-router beforeEnter hook
* Your `router-view` is under `keep-alive`
* Your components related to different routes have getters mapped to static module
* Bug: when you enter route which should register new vuex module, getters from static module become broken.
Reactivity doesn't work - components with mapped getters do not receive updates.

### What is expected?
Getters should work

### What is actually happening?
Getters reactivity is broken. Components have stale getters values.

---
```
 "dependencies": {
    "vue": "2.5.17-beta.0",
    "vue-router": "^3.0.1",
    "vuex": "^3.0.1"
  }
```

Windows 10, Chrome Version 69.0.3497.100 (Official Build) (64-bit)

P.S. Not really sure if I should put this issue into the vuex repository, so pls tell me if there are better place for it.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Issues.Title: It is possible to sync vuex state across devices?
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
I want to make the same user, authorized on different devices, interact with the site, when the state changes, so that it synchronously changes on all devices.

Back-Ender asks to implement the mechanism via *web sockets*   how-to about **change the state from the server(!)**. 
He says that in *react-redux* he calls action with *type* and some *payload*. 
But vuex has **two entities**: *mutations* and *actions*, which adds complexity! Especially when store is namespaced by modules.


### What does the proposed API look like?
  I would be grateful for any help.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Maybe a doc version selector? Or maybe collapsible section in current doc of historical values accepted. I wouldn't expect this for alpha level releases, but presumably the example I brought up was a valid syntax in an older major released version of VueX.

Issues.Title: Support for IndexedDB
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
It should (in theory) make dealing with Big Data Web Visualizations easier and more performant.

I'm using echarts to render big data vizualizations at the company I work for. The problem is that when my data gets really big (1m records), It's takes way too long to do anything. The app pretty much becomes unresponsive and so now the only alternative I have is to do all of the aggregation on the backend and then return the response.

### What does the proposed API look like?
I would imagine that the vuex instance would send messages back and forth between the serviceworker and itself. The mutations could then be passed as arguments to the serviceworker. The serviceworker would perform the operation and return the aggregated data. If the user does not have third-party-cookies enabled. It would just fall back to the normal Vuex instance.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Support for IndexedDB" (#1416)

And this works. 

Anyway, it seems to me that a getter should'nt change and be a copy in every call. If not this should be good documented with an big warning : " Attention : a getter is mutable, copy it, if you want to play with its ow properties."

Issues.Title: Add ability to turn off devtools on vuex by passing an off options
Issues.Body:
This PR adds the ability to turn off devtools on a per vuex instance level.  This is useful for cases where you have multiple vuex stores on a single page.  A good example is a scenario where teams maintain their own portions of a single app that are all loaded, some of which will have an independent vuex store.

With this option, on the dev side i could turn this off per instance so that I can debug a single store. 

By default, this mirrors what is already in vuex, it just allows for turning off when specified.

```
const store = new Vuex.Store({
  devtools: false
})
```

Follow through on https://github.com/vuejs/vuex/issues/875
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Add ability to turn off devtools on vuex by passing an off options" (#1407)

Import Vuex.
```ts
import Vuex from "vuex";
```
Using before this PR: 
```ts
(Vuex as any).mapActions(...)
```

Using after:
```
Vuex.mapActions(...)
```
